Recommendation_Text: Consider transitioning to Bajra (84% water saving potential). Advisory for Tier 3 districts — monitor GW trend before committing.
Flood_Actions: Proceed with standard Samba sowing calendar. Monitor NE monsoon progress weekly from October 1.
Drought_Actions: SW monsoon 19% below normal. Recommend switching to Bajra for Kuruvai as risk mitigation. Advise farmers to delay Kuruvai planting by 2 weeks pending June rainfall. Restrict pump hours to 8 hours per day if GW drops below 5.1m.
Policy_Narrative: Ariyalur is classified as Tier 3 (Monitor (3-5 year horizon)). The predicted groundwater depth is 4.05m in 2026 and 3.98m by 2028. The water table is currently recovering at 0.23 metres per year. The district is 92% groundwater-dependent for irrigation. Primary SHAP analysis indicates: cumulative seasonal depletion memory is moderating depletion; long-term structural decline trend is moderating depletion; seasonal groundwater volatility is driving depletion upward. Recommended transition to Bajra could reduce water consumption by 84% per kilogram of output.

Primary SHAP analysis indicates: cumulative seasonal depletion memory is moderating depletion; long-term structural decline trend is moderating depletion; Bajra cultivation share is moderating depletion. Recommended transition to Jowar could reduce water consumption by 72% per kilogram of output.

Recommendation_Text: Consider transitioning to Bajra (60% water saving potential). Advisory for Tier 3 districts — monitor GW trend before committing.
Flood_Actions: Proceed with standard Samba sowing calendar. Monitor NE monsoon progress weekly from October 1.
Drought_Actions: SW monsoon 14% below normal. Recommend switching to Bajra for Kuruvai as risk mitigation. Advise farmers to delay Kuruvai planting by 2 weeks pending June rainfall. Restrict pump hours to 8 hours per day if GW drops below 5.9m.
Policy_Narrative: Tirupathur is classified as Tier 3 (Monitor (3-5 year horizon)). The predicted groundwater depth is 4.87m in 2026 and 4.76m by 2028. The water table is currently recovering at 2.95 metres per year. The district is 100% groundwater-dependent for irrigation. Primary SHAP analysis indicates: long-term structural decline trend is moderating depletion; cumulative seasonal depletion memory is driving depletion upward; seasonal groundwater volatility is driving depletion upward. Recommended transition to Bajra could reduce water consumption by 60% per kilogram of output.

Recommendation_Text: Transition to Bajra — 43% water saving potential. Prioritise in Samba season. Coordinate with block agricultural officer.
Flood_Actions: Proceed with standard Samba sowing calendar. Monitor NE monsoon progress weekly from October 1.
Drought_Actions: SW monsoon 53% below normal with GW at 9.3m and 77% groundwater dependency. Mandatory switch to Jowar for Kuruvai season (short-duration variety). Restrict pump operation to 6 hours per day from June 1. Activate district drought relief fund and MNREGS water conservation works. Prioritise drinking water supply over irrigation from May 15.

The water table is currently recovering at 0.23 metres per year. The district is 77% groundwater-dependent for irrigation. Primary SHAP analysis indicates: long-term structural decline trend is driving depletion upward; cumulative seasonal depletion memory is driving depletion upward; Rice cultivation expansion is moderating depletion. Recommended transition to Bajra could reduce water consumption by 43% per kilogram of output.
